ComicInfo.Title: B. F. Goodnrich Autoless - Because You Don't Need a Car, Just Tires; Elvis Pelvis; Gunsmoked; Alfred E. Neuman Answers Your Questions; The Manly Art of Self Defense; Scenes We'd Like To See: The Gladiator and the Empress; MAD Builds a More Civilized Mouse Trap; Motorist Beware!; Bowling; Collegiate Whimsey; Morbid Dick; Alfred E. Neuman Answers Your Questions; What's Happened to the... Pulp Magazines?; A Saw Screams at Midnight; MAD Merit Badges; Walt Dizzy Presents Dizzyland; Alfred E. Neuman Answers Your Questions
ComicInfo.Summary:
B. F. Goodnrich Autoless - Because You Don't Need a Car, Just Tires: Phony ad for tires from B. F. Goodnrich that don't need a car.
Elvis Pelvis: Satirical look at various facets of Elvis Presley's style.
Gunsmoked: Quick recap of typical plots from the show.
Alfred E. Neuman Answers Your Questions: Advice for a man who loves both his wife and taxidermy, but whose wife hates his taxidermy.
The Manly Art of Self Defense: Excerpts from a treatise on The Manly Art of Self Defense by Edmund E. Price, published 1867, with illustrations and new captions.
Scenes We'd Like To See: The Gladiator and the Empress: A man is thrown into the gladiatorial ring and defeats a better armed opponent...but loses to a lion.
MAD Builds a More Civilized Mouse Trap: Several supposedly civilized ways to trap and kill mice.
Motorist Beware!: Describes the escalating efforts of police to patrol highways unnoticed, including several of the latest unmarked vehicles.
Bowling: Shows the scoring, style tips, psychological underpinnings, and problems of bowling.
Collegiate Whimsey: Gag cartoons from the following college publications: Iowa State Green Gander; Harvard Lampoon; Stanford Chaparral; Florida Smoke Signals; Cornell Widow; Minnesota Daily; Michigan Gargoyle; California Pelican; U.C.L.A. Scop
Morbid Dick: Tells the tale of the ill-fated voyage of the Peckwad in a vain attempt to kill the white whale.
Alfred E. Neuman Answers Your Questions: Advice to a man whose girlfriend's father threatens that the man will only marry his daughter over his dead body.
What's Happened to the... Pulp Magazines?: Various genres of pulp stories are all given the same treatment, showing underlying similarity.
A Saw Screams at Midnight: Techniques for using a band saw.
MAD Merit Badges: Scout-type merit badges for everyday lazy, loutish clods.
Walt Dizzy Presents Dizzyland: Behind the scenes look at the 5 worlds of Dizzyland: Tomorrowsland, Frontrearland, Adventuresland, Fantasticland, Moneyland.
Alfred E. Neuman Answers Your Questions: Advice for a girl who's being stalked by a boy.
ComicInfo.Writer: Al Feldstein,Edmund E. Price,Phil Interlandi,Nick Meglin,Rice,Bill Davis,Parks,Ilnicki,Jerry Lee,Kent,Thomas,James Blish,Carl Reiner
